name: Water
game_use: Restores health. Causes violent reaction with alkali metals.
real_world_use: Drinking, cooking, life itself
story_relevance: Act 1 tutorial — Aldric demonstrates basic bonding

name: Sodium Chloride
game_use: Preserves food items. Crafts into the Purification Lattice.
real_world_use: Table salt, food preservation, de-icing roads
story_relevance: Act 1 — component of the Purification Lattice

name: Calcium Sulfate
game_use: Building material. Used in Purification Lattice construction.
real_world_use: Plaster of Paris, drywall, fertilizer
story_relevance: Act 1 — Aldric needs Ca and S for the Purification Lattice

name: Silver Oxide
game_use: Antimicrobial coating. Key component of the Purification Lattice filter layer.
real_world_use: Antimicrobial coatings, batteries, water purification
story_relevance: Act 1 — the third element Ash must retrieve for Aldric

name: Purification Lattice
game_use: Seals the Ashwick well against Corrosion Storm decay. Quest item — Act 1 finale.
real_world_use: Inspired by real multi-stage water filtration systems
story_relevance: Act 1 finale — save the village well

name: Steel
game_use: Strongest early-game building block. Crafts tools and structural blocks.
real_world_use: Construction, vehicles, tools — backbone of modern civilization

name: Bronze
game_use: Mid-tier tool material. Crafts pickaxes and blades.
real_world_use: One of humanity's first alloys — used for tools and weapons for millennia

name: Brass
game_use: Crafts gears, decorative blocks, and musical instruments.
real_world_use: Musical instruments, plumbing, coins

name: Glass
game_use: Transparent building block. Required for greenhouse structures and windows.
real_world_use: Windows, lenses, containers, fiber optics

name: Concrete
game_use: Heaviest structural block. High blast resistance.
real_world_use: Construction — the most widely used building material on Earth

name: Iron Oxide (Rust)
game_use: Weakens Iron Construct enemies. Ingredient in thermite.
real_world_use: Pigments, polishing, thermite reactions

name: Thermite
game_use: Extreme heat weapon. Destroys metal-based enemies and sealed doors. Cannot be extinguished by water.
real_world_use: Welding railway tracks, incendiary devices, cutting metal

name: Gunpowder
game_use: Mining explosive. Crafts bombs and flintlock weapons.
real_world_use: Fireworks, mining, historical weaponry

name: Hydrogen Peroxide
game_use: Heals wounds over time. Removes poison status.
real_world_use: Antiseptic, bleaching agent, rocket propellant

name: Aspirin
game_use: Restores health and removes fever status effect.
real_world_use: Pain relief, anti-inflammatory, blood thinner

name: Ammonia
game_use: Fertilizes carbonite moss farms. Ingredient in explosives.
real_world_use: Fertilizers (feeds half the world's population), cleaning products

name: Chlorine Gas
game_use: Toxic AoE cloud. Damages organic enemies over time. Disperses in wind.
real_world_use: Water purification (diluted), chemical manufacturing

name: Hydrogen Sulfide
game_use: Poison weapon. Stuns enemies briefly. Highly unpleasant smell warns nearby NPCs.
real_world_use: Naturally produced by volcanoes and decay. Toxic in concentration.

name: Magnesium Oxide (Flare)
game_use: Emits blinding white light for 60 seconds. Stuns light-sensitive enemies.
real_world_use: Signal flares, fireworks, flash photography

name: Neon (Excited State)
game_use: Permanent light source with red-orange glow. Decorative building block.
real_world_use: Neon signs, lasers, cryogenics

name: Calcium Phosphate (Phosphor)
game_use: Soft white light. Used in crafting the Compendium reader table.
real_world_use: Fluorescent lights, television screens, glow-in-the-dark materials

name: Sodium Hydroxide (Lye)
game_use: Dissolves organic matter. Crafts soap. Corrodes Iron Constructs.
real_world_use: Soap making, paper production, drain cleaner

name: Copper Wire
game_use: Conducts electricity for traps, light circuits, and the Resonance Engine.
real_world_use: Electrical wiring — used in virtually every electronic device

name: Titanium Alloy
game_use: Endgame tool material. Lightest strongest armour and weapons.
real_world_use: Aircraft, spacecraft, surgical implants

name: Alkali Conductor Array
game_use: Resonance Engine component #1. Collected in Chapter 1 — Surface Plains.
real_world_use: Alkali metals are used in batteries, heat transfer, and electronics

name: Ferromagnetic Core
game_use: Resonance Engine component #2. Collected in Chapter 2 — Underground Mines.
real_world_use: The basis of all electromagnets and electric motors

name: Noble Gas Resonator
game_use: Resonance Engine component #3. Immune to Hollow corruption — chemically inert. Collected in Chapter 3.
real_world_use: Noble gases used in lasers, lighting, and cryogenics

name: Thermal Amplifier Coil
game_use: Resonance Engine component #4. Lightweight and heat-resistant. Collected in Chapter 4 — Sky Islands.
real_world_use: Lightweight alloys used in aerospace

name: Electrolytic Stabilizer
game_use: Resonance Engine component #5. Regulates electrical signal in the Engine. Collected in Chapter 5 — Ocean Floor.
real_world_use: Mercury, copper and bromine all used in electrochemical applications

name: The Resonance Engine
game_use: The final device. Broadcasts Periodic knowledge across Atoma. Ends Act 3.
real_world_use: Inspired by radio broadcast technology and nuclear energy
story_relevance: Final quest item — completes the game's main story

name: Methane
game_use: Fuel for torches and engines. Burns hot and fast.
real_world_use: Natural gas — used for heating, cooking, and electricity generation

name: Ethanol
game_use: Burns cleanly. Used as antiseptic and fuel. Crafts into medicine.
real_world_use: Alcoholic drinks, fuel, antiseptics, solvents

name: Aluminium Oxide (Ceramic)
game_use: Heat-resistant building block. Protects structures from magma and thermite.
real_world_use: Ceramics, abrasives, armor plating, spark plugs

name: Sulfuric Acid
game_use: Dissolves metal blocks. Damages Iron Construct enemies heavily. Hazardous — damages Ash if mishandled.
real_world_use: The most industrially produced chemical in the world — batteries, fertilizers, ore processing

name: Calcium Carbonate
game_use: Common building block. Reacts with acid to produce CO₂ — useful for traps.
real_world_use: Limestone, chalk, marble — one of the most common minerals on Earth

name: Carbon Dioxide
game_use: Extinguishes fires. Fills enclosed spaces and suffocates enemies. Used in greenhouses.
real_world_use: Carbonated drinks, fire extinguishers, plant photosynthesis

name: Potassium Nitrate
game_use: Fertilizer and gunpowder ingredient. Preserves food.
real_world_use: Gunpowder component, food preservation, fertilizer
